content.text:
# List of wars involving Panama

This is a list of wars involving the Republic of Panama from the colonial period to the modern era.
Colonial era
Anglo-Spanish War (1585–1604):
* Drake's Assault on Panama (1596)
* Capture of Portobello (1601)
Anglo-Spanish War (1727–1729): Blockade of Porto Bello (1726 – 1728)
War of Jenkins' Ear: Battle of Porto Bello (1739)
Independence era
{| class="wikitable"
|-
! style="background:#002299" rowspan="1" |Conflict
! style="background:#002299" rowspan="1" width=170px| Combatant 1
! style="background:#002299" rowspan="1" width=170px| Combatant 2
! style="background:#002299" rowspan="1" width=340px| Results
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| Gran Colombia–Peru War(1828–1829)
|style="background:#efefef"|
*  Panama
|style="background:#efefef"|
|style="background:#efefef"| Stalemate
* Peruvian land invasion lost momentum after battle of Tarqui; at sea, Peru maintained supremacy after the fall of Guayaquil
* War came to an end with the signing of the Gual-Larrea treaty and the unexpected coup-de-etat against President La Mar
* Colombian troops were driven out of Bolivia, Peru recognized the Colombian annexation of Guayaquil and Colombia recognized implicitly Peruvian sovereignty of Tumbes, Jaen and Maynas
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| Watermelon Riot(1856)
|style="background:#efefef"|
*  Panama
|style="background:#efefef"|
|style="background:#efefef"| Defeat
* Herrán-Cass Agreement signed
* New Granadian government established a sum compensation of $412,394 in gold for damages
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| Panama Crisis(1885)
|style="background:#efefef"|  Panamanian Rebels
|style="background:#efefef"|  Colombia
|style="background:#efefef"| Defeat
* Rebellion suppressed
* Colón burned
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| Thousand Days' War(1899–1902)
|style="background:#efefef"|  Colombian Conservative Party
|style="background:#efefef"|  Colombian Liberal Party
|style="background:#efefef"| Victory
* War won by conservative government
* Continuation of the present day Republic of Colombia
* Resulted in Panamanian independence
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| World War I(1917–1918)
|style="background:#efefef"|
|style="background:#efefef"|
|style="background:#efefef"| Victory
* End of the German, Russian, Ottoman, and Austro-Hungarian empires
* Formation of new countries in Europe and the Middle East
* Transfer of German colonies and regions of the former Ottoman Empire to other powers
* Establishment of the League of Nations
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| Coto War(1921)
|style="background:#efefef"|
|style="background:#efefef"|
|style="background:#efefef"| Defeat
* Panama ceded Coto to Costa Rica
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| World War II(1941–1945)
|style="background:#efefef"|
|style="background:#efefef"|
|style="background:#efefef"| Victory
* Collapse of the Third Reich
* Fall of Japanese and Italian Empires
* Creation of the United Nations
* Emergence of the United States and the Soviet Union as superpowers
* Beginning of the Cold War
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| Cuban invasion of Panama(1959)
|style="background:#efefef"|
|style="background:#efefef"|
|style="background:#efefef"| Victory
* Cuban expedition fails
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| Insurgency in Chiriquí(1968–1971)
|style="background:#efefef"|
|style="background:#efefef"|  Pro-Arias Guerrillas
|style="background:#efefef"| Victory
* Guerrillas defeated
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| Nicaraguan Revolution(1978-1979)
|style="background:#efefef"|  FSLN
* EPS
MAP-ML
* MILPAS
|style="background:#efefef"|  Somoza regime
* National Guard
|style="background:#efefef"| Victory
* Overthrow of Somoza government in 1979 by FSLN forces, with military assistance from Panama's Victoriano Lorenzo Brigade commanded by Hugo Spadafora
* Insurgency of the Contras, with clandestine support from Panamanian military government under Manuel Noriega from 1981-87
* FSLN junta led by Daniel Ortega take power of Nicaragua in 1981
* Electoral victory of FSLN in 1984
* Electoral victory of the National Opposition Union in 1990
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| United States Invasion of Panama(1989–1990)
|style="background:#efefef"|
|style="background:#efefef"|  Panamanian Opposition
|style="background:#efefef"| Defeat
* Dictator Manuel Noriega deposed
|}
